modules.description: The module offers low-level byte and numeric operations for reading/writing signed/unsigned integers of varying bit widths (8, 16, 31, 32, 64) and substrings, supporting both big-endian and little-endian byte orders. It works with buffer types like `Buffer.t` and Bigarray-based structures, providing safe and unsafe variants for controlled memory access. Use cases include network protocol parsing, binary file manipulation, and performance-critical applications requiring direct memory handling.

Provides asynchronous I/O operations for reading from and writing to file descriptors, including non-blocking read and write functions. Works with file descriptors, byte buffers, and asynchronous event loops. Used to implement network servers that handle multiple connections without blocking.

Provides low-level byte and numeric manipulation for reading and writing signed and unsigned integers across multiple bit widths and endianness formats. Supports buffer types such as `Buffer.t` and Bigarray, with safe and unsafe access options for precise memory control. Enables tasks like network packet parsing, binary file editing, and high-performance data processing. Examples include extracting a 32-bit little-endian integer from a buffer or writing a 16-bit big-endian value to a Bigarray.
